param.name: annotation_databases
param.label: Choose a gemini annotation source

param.name: infile
param.label: GEMINI database
param.help: Only files with version @VERSION@ are accepted.

param.name: header
param.label: Add a header of column names to the output

param.name: radius
param.label: Set filter for Breadth-first search (BFS) in the Protein-Protein Interaction network

param.name: variant_mode
param.label: Returns variant info (e.g. impact, biotype) for interacting genes

param.name: report_selector
param.label: Set of columns to include in the variant report table
param.option: Minimal (report only a preconfigured minimal set of columns)
Full (report all columns defined in the GEMINI database variants table)

param.name: columns
param.label: Choose columns to include in the report

param.name: extra_cols
param.label: Additional columns (comma-separated)

param.name: filter
param.label: Additional constraints expressed in SQL syntax
param.help: Constraints defined here will become the WHERE clause of the SQL query issued to the GEMINI database. E.g. alt='G' or impact_severity = 'HIGH'.

xml.name: lenient
xml.token_help: The exact consequence of this setting depends on the type of inheritance pattern you are looking for (see the tool help below).

param.name: lenient
param.label: Include hits with less convincing inheritance patterns

param.name: allow_unaffected
param.label: Report candidates shared by unaffected samples
param.help: Activating this option will enable the reporting of variants as candidate causative even if they are shared by unaffected samples in the family tree. The default will only report variants that are unique to affected samples.

param.name: min_kindreds
param.label: Minimum number of families with a candidate variant for a gene to be reported
param.help: This is the number of families required to have a variant fitting the inheritance model in the same gene in order for the gene and its variants to be reported. For example, we may only be interested in candidates where at least 4 families have a variant (with a fitting inheritance pattern) in that gene.

param.name: overwrite_default_filter
param.label: Overwrite the default constraint of this tool
param.help: By default, this tool restricts its analysis to @DEFAULT_WHERE@ and this constraint is applied on top of any constraint expressed above. With this option here selected, your custom constraint, if given, will overwrite the default instead.

param.name: gt_filter
param.label: Restrictions to apply to genotype values

validator.message: Genotype filter expression cannot be empty

param.name: sample_filter
param.label: SQL filter to use to filter the sample table

validator.message: Sample filter expression cannot be empty

param.name: in
param.label: A variant must be in either all, none or any samples passing the sample-query filter
param.option: Return a variant if it is found in any sample passing the sample filter. (default)
Return a variant if it is found in ALL samples passing the sample filter. (all)
Return a variant if it is found in NO sample passing the sample filter. (none)
Return a variant if it is found in any sample passing the sample filter, and in NO sample NOT passing it. (only)
Return a variant if is found in ALL samples passing the sample filter, and in NO sample NOT passing it. (only all)

param.name: family_wise
param.label: Apply the sample-filter on a family-wise basis

repeat.name: regions
repeat.title: Region Filter
repeat.help: Filter variant sites by their position in the genome. If multiple Region Filters are specified, all variants that fall in ONE of the regions are reported.

param.name: chrom
param.label: Chromosome

validator.message: A chromosome identifier is required when specifying a region filter

param.name: start
param.label: Region Start

param.name: stop
param.label: Region End
